intro: Tiliacora stipularis, commonly known as the Indian senna or arrowroot plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant also has ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
